Package ch.idsia.crema.search.impl

Class AbstractSearch<M,​S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.idsia.crema.search.impl.AbstractSearch<M,​S>
  • Type Parameters:
    M -
    S -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISearch<M,​S>, IStatCapable<M>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Greedy, GreedyWithRandomRestart, LocalSearch, RandomWalk
    public abstract class AbstractSearch<M,​S>
extends Object
implements ISearch<M,​S>, IStatCapable<M>
    A common implementation of a search algorith offering observers, progress and stats. The class also implement the run as a consecutive series of calls to step (which is abstract).

    Contributions to the progress are possible overriding the getProgress() method. This will return a value [0-1] indicating any other limit's progress. This value is maxed with the time and iteration progress.

    Author:
    david

      • best

        public S best()
        Description copied from interface: ISearch
        Returns the best solution found up to this moment. If step() did not return false the best solution might change after a further call to step. On the other hand when step did return false, best must return the same solution all the time. Changes that will make step continue the search (increase in max iterations)
        Specified by:
        best in interface ISearch<M,​S>
        Returns:

      • step

        protected abstract boolean step()
        Performs a single step in the search. The method returns true if a move has been performed. When the method returns false one can expect that any further call to step will not move the searcher from the current solution. This is particularly useful to interrupt a loop that calls step: 
        
 while(search.step());

        An implementation of this interface could also include an iteration counter and set an iteration limit. The implementation must then also check that if the maximum number of iterations has been reached a call to step will just return false and not perform a move.

        Moves do not necessarily have to improve the best solution.

        Returns:
        true when a move has been done.

      • setStop
